entries.meaning: A shout of approbation, favor, or assent; eager expression of approval; loud applause.
The act of winning an election to a post because there were no other candidates.
examples: With no one running against her, she won by acclamation.

entries.meaning: (art) A representation, in sculpture or on medals, of people expressing joy.
examples: The medals on which laudatory acclamations are recorded are called by antiquaries acclamation medals.

entries.meaning: (politics) An oral vote taken without formal ballot and with much fanfare; typically an overwhelmingly affirmative vote.
